message.content:
cs.CY, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.HC 

This paper focuses on the design and implementation of a gamification approach for supporting user engagement and integration in a human-centric cyber-physical system to improve energy efficiency in smart buildings. This involves the utilization of cutting-edge Internet of Things (IoT) sensors and cyber-physical systems sensing/actuation platforms, which falls under the category of cyber-physical systems (cs.CY). The paper also proposes the use of a benchmark utility learning framework and Deep Learning end-to-end training with Deep bi-directional Recurrent Neural Networks, which are techniques commonly used in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and machine learning (cs.LG). The study also involves modeling user interaction as a sequential discrete game between non-cooperative players, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper focuses on improving user engagement and integration in a human-centric cyber-physical system, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
